intro: Maximilianea gregorii, commonly known as the Gregorii's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Maximilianea gregorii is a member of the milkweed family (Asclepiadaceae) and serves as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
